Weather: Mostly sunny, light winds most of the week
Air Temp: High and low in the low 80's.

Bonefish: Bonefish action was perfect. Anglers did well wade fishing and from the boat.
Permit: Permit were caught on fly and spin.  Anglers got shots at some exceptionally large fish.
Tarpon: Good weather had many guides and anglers making the run to look for big migratory Tarpon.
Other Species:
Snook, Snapper, Jacks, Lookdown and Barracuda.

‍
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in orange, pearl and pink sizes 6 & 8
Permit Flies: Spawning Shrimp, Tan Crabs in size 6 & 8.
Tarpon Flies: White or Chartreuse Tarpon Toads.
Post Summary: Good weather and wind conditions provided plenty of action on all of the areas El Pescador guides fish.
Post Body: Good weather and wind conditions provided plenty of action on all of the areas El Pescador guides fish.

Weather: Heavy rain, wind, and thundershowers early in the week.
Grand Slam: None this week
Bonefish: About 200 bones were landed for the week, most were in the 2-4 pound range.
Tarpon: Nine Tarpon landed.
Other Species: Three snook.
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in gold, pearl and pink sizes 4 & 6, and Crazy Charlies in pink and orange.
Permit Flies: Mantis shrimp, rag head crabs and Flexo crabs.
Tarpon Flies: White bunnies, chartreuse and black-purple toads.
Post Summary: Early in the week, our guides and anglers battled a large weather front that impacted fishing for several days. Anglers did manage to land some larger Bonefish, and a couple of good-sized Tarpon. By week's end, our skies cleared, and winds dropped.
Post Body:
Early in the week, our guides and anglers battled a large weather front that impacted fishing for several days. Anglers did manage to land some larger Bonefish, and a couple of good-sized Tarpon. By week's end, our skies cleared, and winds dropped.

‍

Weather: Partly cloudy with intermittent rain and moderate wind conditions during the middle of most days. Temperatures have settled in the low 80s. k.
Bonefish: Good numbers of Bonefish (134) were landed, averaging 2 to 3 lbs, several ranging from 3 to 6 lbs.
Tarpon: Four this week.
Other Species:
Snook: Six.

Snapper and Jack Crevalle landed West along the Mainland Coastline.
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in gold, pearl, root beer and pink sizes 4 & 6.
Permit Flies: Mantis shrimp, Rag Head crabs, Bauer crabs and Alflexo crabs in sizes 4 & 6.
Tarpon Flies: White Chartreuse Bunnies, Chartreuse and Black-purple toads in sizes 1/0 to 3/0.
Post Summary: The trend over Ambergris Caye has been the Rolling fronts and intermittent rain. Wind conditions are from the E/NE 10-20 consistently. Catch rates continue to remain below average, and low light conditions require guides to resort to catching Bonefish largely through tailing or waking on the flats. Likewise, Permit and Tarpon have been challenging to find, and catch rates remain below average. Small Tarpon and Snook can be found in and around mangrove growth but require greater accuracy to hook up.
Post Body: The trend over Ambergris Caye has been the Rolling fronts and intermittent rain. Wind conditions are from the E/NE 10-20 consistently. Catch rates continue to remain below average, and low light conditions require guides to resort to catching Bonefish largely through tailing or waking on the flats. Likewise, Permit and Tarpon have been challenging to find, and catch rates remain below average. Small Tarpon and Snook can be found in and around mangrove growth but require greater accuracy to hook up.
main image caption: Phoenix caught a number of really impressive fish when on the water with Capt. Gordy.

Weather: We had very low winds during the week with cloudy skies and a lot of rain during the week..with wind going 5 to10 kts direction was north east.the sea state was slight and light chop.
Moon Phase: new Moon1 Nov 2024, third quarter 24 Oct 2024
Bonefish: 112 bones were landed for the week, most were in the 2-4 pound range.
Tarpon:
Anglers landed 11 Tarpon for the week.

‍
Other Species: - Barracuda- Jacks- Snapper
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials 4 & 6 - Crazy Charlie's
Permit Flies: - Squimp - size 6, 8 - tan - Grand Slam Crab - size 6 - Spawning Shrimp - size 6 - Mantis Shrimp - size 6, 8 - Bauer Flats Crab - size 4 - tan
Tarpon Flies: - Tarpon Toad - size 1/0 to 3/0 - White, Chartreuse, Black, Black/Red, Tan - Tarpon Bunnies - size 1/0 to 3/0- White, Chartreuse, Black, Black/Red, Olive, Tan - Deceiver - size 1/0-3/0 - White, Chartreuse/White, Blue/White
Post Summary: This week was rainy and cloudy so it was hard for them to see permits on the flats but they managed to catch bonefish and several juvenile tarpon 20 to 50 pounds. They also catch other fish such as snappers, jacks, barracuda, etc.
Post Body:
This week was rainy and cloudy so it was hard for them to see permits on the flats but they managed to catch bonefish and several juvenile tarpon 20 to 50 pounds. They also catch other fish such as snappers, jacks, barracuda, etc.

‍

Weather: Sunny and breezy at times.
Wind: East 10-15 mph with strong gusts as TS Nate passed
Grand Slam: None this week.
Bonefish:
An awesome week to be in Belize! To spite the threat of TS Nate, anglers that visited us this week enjoyed great bonefishing and beautiful weather. The low tide has happened when the sun is high which makes it easier to see all those bonefish coming your way. First time bone fisherman and women have all been successful catching that coveted fish

‍
Permit:
The permit were receptive to the fly this week. Anglers landed as many as three in one day, which is a tall order when it comes to Permit fishing. Craig was one of those guys that enjoyed the tug of three fish in a single day with two making it to the boat. Thanks to everyone for being part of this week at the lodge. We look forward to the next time! The fish will be waiting.

‍
Tarpon:
Once again the Tarpon are around in large numbers. Long Caye, down south, continues to lure guides and anglers in search of larger fish. Michael decided to take his chances the day TS Nate passed by and managed to land three Tarpon. What a beautiful end to his and Katie’s honeymoon week!

‍
Other Species: Snapper, cobia, triggerfish, and barracuda.
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in orange, pearl and pink size 6- 8
Permit Flies: Peterson Shrimp, Mantis shrimp and Avalon crabs.
Tarpon Flies: Toads and bunnies, black on black, red on black, tan and olive are all great.
Post Summary: Our thoughts turn to the gulf coast as they experienced Nate’s arrival.
Post Body:
The threat of Tropical Storm Nate was just that, a threat that thankfully did not materialize. The fishing did not disappoint.  Bones were active and easy to see in the low tides with a high sun. Lots landed. The permit fishing was hot. One angler managed two out of three to the boat! Tarpon around in large numbers, always a challenge to land.

‍

Weather: Strong winds, some storms, and rain.
Air Temp: Highs in the mid 80's, Lows in the high 70's
Grand Slam: Congratulations to Chris P., Chuck S. and our new General Manager Jenny Mayrell-Woodruff for Grand Slams this week.
Bonefish:
Even on the bad weather days bonefish kept the action going on protected flats and in the lee of the cayes.

‍
Permit:
Good numbers of permit around in several areas.  Some nice ones were landed. Including several that were "firsts" for the angler.

‍
Tarpon:
Strong east winds kept most of the boats off Savannah flats this week, but tarpon were landed around the Mangroves in several locations. Some big ones were rolling at the south end of the areas we fish.

‍
Other Species:
Snapper, jacks

‍
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in orange, pearl and pink sizes 6 & 8
Permit Flies: Grand Slam Crab, Tan Squimp in size 6&8, Mantis Shrimp.
Tarpon Flies: Chartreuse, white, red and black, all black and black and purple toads and bunnies continue to work well.
Post Summary: Tougher than usual week for wind and weather. Upcoming forecast is much improved.
Post Body:
Tougher than usual week for wind and weather. Upcoming forecast is much improved.

Post Summary: Sunny days and light winds made for good sight casting. Three Grand Slams and a Super Grand Slam. Good fishing all around. El Pescador was honored to host the 2018 Redbone Belize Superslam Tournament raising money for Cystic Fibrosis research, lots of wonderful friends, great fishing, and lots of funds raised for this terrific cause!
Post Body: Sunny days and light winds made for good sight casting.  El Pescador was honored to host the 2018 Redbone Belize Superslam Tournament raising money for Cystic Fibrosis research, lots of wonderful friends, great fishing, and lots of funds raised for this terrific cause!   All of us here look forward to helping again with this worthwhile cause when they return in 2019.

Post Summary: The first cold front of the 2018/2019 winter season produced strong northwest winds, cloudy days and cooler than normal temps. Anglers and guides were able to put together some good days by moving and adapting to the weather and water conditions. El Pescador Lodge was happy to host a fly fishing and photography workshop by Yellow Dog Outfitters featuring well known outdoor photographers Jim Klug and Bryan Gregson.
Post Body:
The first cold front of the 2018/2019 winter season produced strong northwest winds, cloudy days and cooler than normal temps.

Anglers and guides were able to put together some good days by moving and adapting to the weather and water conditions.  

El Pescador Lodge was happy to host a fly fishing and photography workshop by Yellow Dog Outfitters featuring well known outdoor photographers Jim Klug and Bryan Gregson.  It was a treat to see the amazing images captured by the participants while on land and in and under the water.

‍

Grand Slam: Steph and Stan both got their first-ever Grand Slams. Pete Kutzer landed the second Grand Slam of his visit.
Bonefish: Clearwater and light winds provided action from boats or wading.
Permit: Permit action has remained good through the summer months.
Tarpon: Good conditions provided the chance to cast to Tarpon on the open flats.
Other Species: Snook, Snapper, Jacks, Ladyfish and Barracuda.
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in orange, pearl and pink sizes 6 & 8
Permit Flies: Spawning Shrimp, Tan Crabs in size 6 & 8.
Tarpon Flies: White or Chartreuse Tarpon Toads.
Post Summary: A week of beautiful weather provided opportunities for a variety of species. Congratulations to El Pescador guides Junior and Cesar Acosta on taking first prize in the 2019 Silver Scales Fly Fishing Tournament in Xcalak, Mexico!
Post Body: A week of beautiful weather provided opportunities for a variety of species. Congratulations to El Pescador guides Junior and Cesar Acosta on taking first prize in the 2019 Silver Scales Fly Fishing Tournament in Xcalak, Mexico!
main image caption: Jake and Kirsti doubled up on Jacks with Guide Alex O.

Weather: Mostly sunny, light winds most of the week
Air Temp: High and low in the low 80's.
Bonefish: Bonefish action has been good for both numbers and size. Many anglers have landed hefty Bones over 20".
Permit: Permit fishing continues to be good.  Bacalar Chico area has been a hotspot the past week.
Tarpon: Tarpon have been landed on the flats, around the Mangroves and migratory Tarpon continue to be an option around the Cayes and channels south of the lodge.
Other Species:
Snook, Snapper, Jacks and Barracuda.

‍

Post Summary: Good weather and wind conditions provided lots of opportunities to fish a variety of areas. Highlights of the week included Joel landing two Tarpon on his last day and a Father/Son double on Tarpon by Wade and Matthew.
Post Body: Good weather and wind conditions provided lots of opportunities to fish a variety of areas. Highlights of the week included Joel landing two Tarpon on his last day and a Father/Son double on Tarpon by Wade and Matthew.

Bonefish: Very good week for numbers of Bonefish on the fly.
Permit: Several nice size Permit were landed on the fly.

Weather: Most days have been partly cloudy in the AM and clearing around mid morning.
Air Temp: High and low in the mid 80's.
Grand Slam: Two this week! Brady H. with Capt. Junior, Teddy W. with Capt. Jeo
Bonefish:
Very good week for numbers of Bonefish on the fly with a few large bonefish in the 5 lb range.

‍
Permit: Multiple permit were landed throughout the week.
Tarpon: Light winds and clear water provided great opportunities for all three size class of tarpon. Baby tarpon were found in the mangroves and back lagoons. Resident tarpon found throughout the fishery, and a few large migratory tarpon were jumped in the channels.
Other Species: Snapper, Jacks, Shark, Lady Fish, and Barracuda.
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in orange, pearl and pink sizes 6 & 8
Permit Flies: Spawning Shrimp, Olive EP Permit Crabs in size 4.
Tarpon Flies: White and Chartreuse Tarpon Toads, Queso Home Slice.
Post Summary: Overall, it was a great week on the water with a lot of fish to hand for our anglers. The weather this month has been great. We did have a storm that passed over on Tuesday but moved through quickly, opening back up to sunny skies and lighter winds on Wednesday. All anglers enjoyed hooking and landed numerous Bonefish. The anglers that pursued permit had positive results with lots of opportunities and multiple permit to hand. The tarpon fishing continues to be great, with lots of fish being jumped and quite a few to hand. Lastly, we had two grand slams this last week, which are always a highlight. El Pescador is proud to be the best destination for anglers pursuing a diversity of species and the possibility to achieve the coveted flats grand slam and super slam.
Post Body:
Overall, it was a great week on the water with a lot of fish to hand for our anglers. The weather this month has been great. We did have a storm that passed over on Tuesday but moved through quickly, opening back up to sunny skies and lighter winds on Wednesday. All anglers enjoyed hooking and landed numerous Bonefish. The anglers that pursued permit had positive results with lots of opportunities and multiple permit to hand. The tarpon fishing continues to be great, with lots of fish being jumped and quite a few to hand. Lastly, we had two grand slams this last week, which are always a highlight. El Pescador is proud to be the best destination for anglers pursuing a diversity of species and the possibility to achieve the coveted flats grand slam and super slam.

‍

Weather: Most days provided great weather conditions with lighter winds.
Air Temp: High and low in the mid 80's.
Grand Slam: Mick F. And guide Kristian
Bonefish: Excellent week for numbers of Bonefish on the fly with the high boat for the week, having landed 25 between two anglers.
Permit: This week provided great permit fishing. For those that targeted permit, the fish were receptive. In total, 11 permit were landed by guests.
Tarpon:
Light winds and clear water provided great opportunities for juvenile and resident tarpon. Baby tarpon were found in the mangroves and back lagoons. During the tidal shift in the AM guides were able to provide anglers with good opportunities. Resident tarpon were found throughout the fishery and responded to well placed flies. There were a few migratory jumped, and one landed.

‍
The number of migratory fish available is still good, but the numbers are certainly dropping as the season begins to come to a close.
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in orange, pearl and pink sizes 6 & 8
Permit Flies: Spawning Shrimp, Camo Crabs in Olive size 4.
Tarpon Flies: White and Yellow Tarpon Toads, Queso Home Slice.
Post Summary: Overall, it was a great week on the water. Lots of opportunities and plenty of fish brought to hand for our anglers.
Post Body: Overall, it was a great week on the water.  Lots of opportunities and plenty of fish brought to hand for our anglers. The weather this month has been great. We did have a storm that passed early in the week but moved through quickly, opening back up to sunny skies and lighter winds. All anglers enjoyed hooking and landing bonefish. Some had record number days beating their previous top bonefish days.

Weather: Partly Cloudy in the morning with a few quick rain showers shifting to sunny around midmorning.
Wind: The week started with winds coming out of the West / North West and shifted to the typical Easterly winds. Wind speeds were in the 5 - 8 mph range to start the week. By the end of the week with the shift in wind direction the winds increased to an average of 10mph.
Air Temp: High and low in the low 80's.
Grand Slam: We didn't have any grand slams this week.
Bonefish:
Very good week for numbers of Bonefish on the fly.

‍
Permit: Multiple permit were landed throughout the week.
Tarpon: Light winds and clear water gave opportunities for resident and a few migratory tarpon on the flats.  Numerous anglers jumped and landed multiple tarpon during their stay with us with the largest landed tarpon being roughly 90 pounds.
Other Species: Snapper, Jacks, Triple Tail, and Barracuda.
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in orange, pearl and pink sizes 6 & 8
Permit Flies: Spawning Shrimp, Camo Crabs in size 6.
Tarpon Flies: White, Chartreuse or Yellow Tarpon Toads.
Post Summary: The average and upper size of Bonefish continues to increase as a result of catch and release only regulations implemented 10 years ago by the Government of Belize. The tarpon fishing has remained good and there are still migratory fish around for those interested. The permit fishing is providing quite a few opportunities for those interested in pursuing. The weather has been great and providing good conditions for anglers, especially for the early morning bite.
Post Body: The average and upper size of Bonefish continues to increase as a result of catch and release only regulations implemented 10 years ago by the Government of Belize.  The tarpon fishing has remained good and there are still migratory fish around for those interested.  The permit fishing is providing quite a few opportunities for those interested in pursuing.  The weather has been great and providing good conditions for anglers, especially for the early morning bite.

Weather: Partly cloudy days with a few isolated showers and thunderstorms. Mostly calm to light winds.
Wind: North to NE and NW, 8 - 12 mph
Air Temp: High and low in the mid 80's.
Grand Slam: Close, but no cigar!
Bonefish:
Large numbers of bonefish caught this week. Nearly every angler caught bonefish almost every day.

‍
Permit: Another great week for permit with a minimum of one or two fish being caught nearly every day by someone at the lodge and included some beautiful fish in the 15-20 lb. range.
Tarpon: A few tarpon were landed this week on the fly and large numbers of fish were seen at times, although weather conditions seemed to play a role in their willingness to eat. A few larger migratory fish are still around. Most of the fish landed on the fly were juvenile fish from 5 to 25 lbs with one bait caught tarpon landed in the 40 lb range.
Other Species: Snook, Snapper, Jacks, Lady Fish, and Barracuda.
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in orange, pearl and pink sizes 6 & 8
Permit Flies: Spawning Shrimp, white crabs of various styles.
Tarpon Flies: White toads and white poppers enticed takes. Smaller tarpon were taken on red and black bucktail deceivers.
Post Summary: A great week, especially for permit anglers. Three novice fly casters took permit this week, and many others were landed by more experienced anglers. A number of snook also were in this week's bag as were a large number of bonefish.
Post Body: A great week, especially for permit anglers. Three novice fly casters took permit this week, and many others were landed by more experienced anglers. A number of snook also were in this week's bag as were a large number of bonefish. Some anglers were blessed with up to 15 bones a day. One incredibly close and powerful thunderstorm drove a few fishermen off the flats temporarily, but guides have been able to dodge most rainstorms and make effective use of their time on the water in the changing light and wind conditions experienced this week.

Weather: Partly cloudy days with a few isolated showers and thunderstorms. Mostly calm to light winds.
Wind: North to NE and NW, 8 - 12 mph
Air Temp: High and low in the mid 80's.
Grand Slam: Two person teams on Redbone boats landed a number of grand slams, one double slam and a super slam during the competition this past week!
Bonefish: Large numbers of bonefish were caught this week during the three day Redbone Tournament. 158 to be exact.
Permit: Redbone anglers landed a total of 9 permit in three days this past week along with a few other anglers at the lodge weighing in with 2 or 3 others.
Tarpon: Six tarpon were landed during the Redbone tournament as well as a few in the back lagoon and an estimated 75-80lb tarpon by the El Pescador fishing host on his day off (he went fishing of course!)
Other Species: Lots of Snook, a few Jacks and Barracuda were also landed.
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in orange, pearl and pink sizes 6 & 8
Permit Flies: Spawning Shrimp, white crabs of various styles.
Tarpon Flies: White toads and a few smaller EP-type baitfish patterns for tarpon and snook, as well as red and black toads took tarpon this week.
Post Summary: Last week, El Pescador hosted over 30 anglers for the Belize edition of the Redbone Tournament "to catch the cure for Cystic Fibrosis." During the three day event, two angler teams fanned out over the 400 square mile fishing area that El Pescador calls home base. In all, the event was a huge success from both a fishing perspective and for money raised towards finding a cure. Many thanks to the crew at Yellow Dog and the organizers at Redbone for an excellent event!
Post Body:
Last week, El Pescador hosted over 30 anglers for the Belize edition of the Redbone Tournament "to catch the cure for Cystic Fibrosis." During the three day event, two angler teams fanned out over the 400 square mile fishing area that El Pescador calls home base. In all, the event was a huge success from both a fishing perspective and for money raised towards finding a cure. Many thanks to the crew at Yellow Dog and the organizers at Redbone for an excellent event!

‍

Weather: Partly cloudy days with isolated showers and a few days of mostly rain. The Northwesterly wind switched two days ago to the Northeast.
Wind: North to NE and NW, 8 - 18 mph
Air Temp: High and low in the mid 80's.
Grand Slam: One grand slam to report with a 40lb tarpon, nice permit, and healthy bone. There were also a couple of near misses as well!
Bonefish: The usual catch of bonefish by nearly every angler, every day has been going strong.
Permit: A few permit were taken on the fly this week, as well as a very large specimen taken on spinning gear.
Tarpon: The tarpon have been a little more cooperative on the flats as well as in the back lagoon. One angler took four in one morning in the back lagoon, and others were jumped and lost with a few landed on the flats.
Other Species: Snook, Snapper, Jacks, and Barracuda
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in orange, pearl and pink sizes 6 & 8
Permit Flies: Spawning Shrimp, white crabs of various styles.
Tarpon Flies: White toads and other white or EP style flies.
Post Summary: Sight fishing was tough with clouds and a few rain days, making it hard to see fish. That did not stop one angler from a Grand Slam, and a few others almost achieved it as well. Bones were receptive and available regardless. Anglers had no trouble getting into them. Those seeking Permit had their work cut out for them, but three landed. Tarpon available on the flats, and the back lagoon enticed and rewarded anglers. A good number landed, and more jumped as always the case. Lots of smiles during the dock walk at the end of the day.
Post Body: Sight fishing was tough with clouds and a few rain days, making it hard to see fish. That did not stop one angler from a Grand Slam, and a few others almost achieved it as well.  Bones were receptive and available regardless. Anglers had no trouble getting into them. Those seeking Permit had their work cut out for them, but three landed.  Tarpon available on the flats, and the back lagoon enticed and rewarded anglers. A good number landed, and more jumped as always the case.   Lots of smiles during the dock walk at the end of the day.

Weather: Partly cloudy days with a few isolated showers. Recent days have seen ample sun, although changing conditions have been a little challenging for guides, …but they've stepped up with great results.
Wind: North to NE switching to mostly E, 10 - 20 mph
Air Temp: High and low in the mid 80's.
Grand Slam: One grand slam to report and one near miss that technically might have qualified if the angler had known that once leadered, it could count as a caught fish.
Bonefish: Bonefish for in ample supply as usual with nearly every angler catching anywhere from one to a dozen. A couple of fish in the 23" range were caught this week as well.
Permit: About 8 permit were taken last week, including one nice fish approaching 20-25 lbs.
Tarpon: A few larger tarpon were jumped and one in the 40 lb range landed, along with quite a few smaller tarpon in the 5-20 lb range.
Other Species: Snook, Snapper, Jacks, and Barracuda
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in orange, pearl and pink sizes 6 & 8
Permit Flies: Spawning Shrimp, brown crab.
Tarpon Flies: White and chartreuse toads, poppers and home ties.
Post Summary: Anglers continued to have plenty of shots this week with a lot of good eats and tarpon coming unbuttoned on the first or second jump. El Pescador advises anglers to practice strip setting and putting away the trout set before venturing out. In all, it was a great week for permit and the tarpon seem to be more willing to be fed flies!
Post Body: Anglers continued to have plenty of shots this week with a lot of good eats and tarpon coming unbuttoned on the first or second jump. El Pescador advises anglers to practice strip setting and putting away the trout set before venturing out. In all, it was a great week for permit and the tarpon seem to be more willing to be fed flies!

Weather: The weather has been good with mostly sunny days and very little wind. We did have one wind day today, but tomorrow looks clear and calm.
Wind: North to NE switching to mostly E, 10 - 15 mph
Air Temp: High and low in the mid 80's.
Grand Slam: One grand slam to report this week. A feat accomplished by Nancy Badovinus. Way to go Nancy!
Bonefish: Bonefishing has been good this last week. Lots of fish on the flats in big groups.  Calm water with little wind has them spooking easily. Nevertheless, guests have been very successful. Good numbers landed with several fish weighing over 5 lbs.
Permit: Permit are being caught every day. It's bang up permit fishing right now. The record this week is three Permit for one angler before noon.  Lots of tailing Permit in the shallow water and everyone is getting quality shots.  With most Permit in the 10-15 pound range and several caught are well over 20 lbs.
Tarpon: A few Tarpon were jumped and landed this week. Lots of guests are getting quality shots in the calm weather.   Several Tarpons in the 20-50 lb range landed.
Other Species:
Snook, Snapper, Jacks, and Barracuda.

‍
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in orange, pearl and pink sizes 6 & 8
Permit Flies: Spawning Shrimp, brown crab.
Tarpon Flies: White and chartreuse toads, poppers, and home ties rounding out the mix.
Post Summary: This has been a great week for Permit, with almost all anglers hooking up. Several with multiple Permit during the stay. A Permit was even caught from the dock. Tarpon fishing has been a little tricky with lots of sightings, but not many landed for the week. Bonefish have been plentiful, and several really large fish caught.
Post Body: This has been a great week for Permit, with almost all anglers hooking up.  Several with multiple Permit during the stay.  A Permit was even caught from the dock.   Tarpon fishing has been a little tricky with lots of sightings, but not many landed for the week.  Bonefish have been plentiful, and several really large fish caught.

Weather: Partly cloudy days with a few isolated showers and thunderstorms. Initially, an Easterly wind at 20-25 Knots subsiding to 10 knots on Sunday.
Air Temp: High and low in the mid 80's. Partly sunny, from 10 am.
Moon Phase: Waning Full moon to last quarter
Grand Slam: No Grand Slams were recorded this week.
Bonefish: Different sized fish from small ( 1 lb ) to average 3-5 Lbs)
Permit: A total of 5 Permit were caught from 10 Lbs to 30 Lbs
Tarpon: Two juvenile fish were taken ranging between 10 and 20 Lbs.
Other Species: Snook, a few Jacks, and Barracuda. Plus different species of Snapper in large numbers were taken.
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in orange, and pink sizes 4 to 8 and silly legs.
Permit Flies: Hermi crabs of various styles and Peterson shrimp
Tarpon Flies: White toads and a few smaller EP-type baitfish patterns for tarpon and snook on bait.
Post Summary: Last week, El Pescador hosted two large "family and friends" groups. Our big group was a wonderful family of 18 from Wisconsin ( Great Green Bay Fans !) In this party, Luke took an excellent 30 Lb Permit! In our "Boston" group, Chris & Tyler took good Permit and Bonefish, respectively.
Post Body:
Last week, El Pescador hosted two large "family and friends" groups. Our big group was a wonderful family of 18 from Wisconsin ( Great Green Bay Fans !) In this party, Luke took an excellent 30 Lb Permit!

In our "Boston"  group, Chris & Tyler took good Permit and Bonefish, respectively.
main image caption: Luke with a very nice Permit.

Weather: Partly cloudy days with a few isolated showers and thunderstorms on most days. Mostly calm to light winds.
Air Temp: High and low in the early 80's.
Grand Slam: No Grand Slams recorded
Bonefish: Small numbers of bonefish were caught this week with one guest making good catches.  Cloud cover played a major role in making sight fishing difficult.
Permit: Small permit were taken on a live crab.
Tarpon: A few small Tarpon were hooked but none landed.
Other Species: A few Jacks and Barracuda were also landed. Large numbers of Snapper were taken on Shrimp.
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in orange, pearl and pink sizes 6 & 8
Post Summary: El Pescador hosted few anglers last week so the fishing was light. From February onward, many more flies will be presented to fish on the flats. Unseasonal rain and cloud cover made fishing tough.
Post Body: El Pescador hosted few anglers last week so the fishing was light.   From February onward, many more flies will be presented to fish on the flats. Unseasonal rain and cloud cover made fishing tough.
main image caption: Guide review of fly patterns with Guest. Photo: Adam Agnew Media

Weather: Mostly sunny with a few showers and moderate winds from NE and West.
Grand Slam: None this week.
Bonefish: Good numbers of Bonefish were caught this week with fish ranging between 1 and 3 Lbs.
Permit:
Two Permit were taken ranging between 10 and 12 Lbs.

‍
Tarpon: Tarpon between 20 and 75 Lbs were aggressive, but none were landed.
Other Species: A few Jacks and Barracuda were also landed. Good numbers of Snapper were taken on Shrimp.
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in orange, pearl and pink sizes 6 & 8 and Crazy Charlies in pink and orange.
Permit Flies: Mantis Shrimp size 6
Tarpon Flies: Black death, white toads, and yellow toads.
Post Summary: Fishing improved with more favorable weather conditions. The fish were more aggressive, and Bonefish were around in good numbers.
main image caption: Photo Credit: @adam_agnew_media

Weather: Mostly sunny with a few showers and moderate to strong winds from North West and South East
Wind: North West and South East 12 - 25 mph
Bonefish: Good numbers of bonefish were caught this week with fish ranging between 1 Lb and 3 Lbs.
Permit: Three permit landed ranging between 10 and 30 Lbs.
Tarpon: Two small Tarpon between 5 and 10 Lbs landed.
Other Species: A few Jacks and Barracuda were also landed. Good numbers of Snapper were taken on Shrimp. One big Snook of 15lbs  landed.
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in orange, pearl, and pink sizes 6 & 8 and Crazy Charlies in pink and orange.
Permit Flies: Mantis Shrimp size 6, white flex crab, and live crab.
Tarpon Flies: Green toads and a white and green deceiver
Post Summary: Last week fishing was mixed with an average bag of bonefish, a variety of Snapper species, and one large permit of 30 Lbs. Wind and cloud cover made conditions a bit tough at times.
Post Body:
Last week fishing was mixed with an average bag of bonefish, a variety of Snapper species, and one large permit of 30 Lbs.
Wind and cloud cover made conditions a bit tough at times.

‍

Weather: Mostly sunny with moderate to strong winds from the East and South East
Bonefish: Good numbers of bonefish were caught this week with fish ranging between 1 Lb and 4 Lbs. We closed the week with a fish of 5 Lbs.
Permit: Three Permit were landed with the fish ranging between 5 and 10 Lbs
Tarpon: One Tarpon of 12 Lbs was landed.
Other Species: A few Jacks and Barracuda were also landed. Good numbers of Snappers taken on Shrimp.
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in orange, pearl and pink sizes 6 & 8 and Crazy Charlies in pink and orange.
Permit Flies: Mantis Shrimp size 6, and white flex crab. All caught on fly.
Tarpon Flies: Split tail purple bunny toad head with silly legs.
Post Summary: Last week, fishing was mixed with an average bag of bonefish, a variety of Snapper species, and one Tarpon and three Permit landed. A fair amount of wind made conditions challenging.
Post Body: Last week, fishing was mixed with an average bag of bonefish, a variety of Snapper species, and one Tarpon and three Permit landed. A fair amount of wind made conditions challenging.

Weather: Nice for half week then a cold front arrived with winds over 25 mph.
Wind: East as 12 mph then 25 mph from the NW
Air Temp: Highs of 90's initially and then dropping into the low 80's.
Grand Slam: One grand slam was achieved this week by Kyle L!
Bonefish: Large numbers of bonefish were caught early on during the week.
Permit: Seven Permit were caught ranging between 10 & 25 pounds.
Tarpon: Four Tarpon were landed between 10 lbs and 60 lbs
Other Species: Snappers, Jacks, and Ladyfish were caught.
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in orange, pearl and pink sizes 6 & 8
Permit Flies: Squibs, flex crabs and Manta shrimps.
Tarpon Flies: Chartreuse, purple and white toad bunnies.
Post Summary: Last week was a tale of two halves. In the first part of the week, we had perfect weather, and our anglers caught good numbers of fish. It then degenerated as the frontal system arrived. Barometric pressure fell, and fishing became quite tough. Anglers who worked hard were still rewarded with several good bonefish.
Post Body: Last week was a tale of two halves. In the first part of the week, we had perfect weather, and our anglers caught good numbers of fish. It then degenerated as the frontal system arrived. Barometric pressure fell, and fishing became quite tough. Anglers who worked hard were still rewarded with several good bonefish.

Weather: Mostly sunny with moderate winds from NE and East
Bonefish: Good numbers of bonefish were caught this week with fish ranging between 1 Lb and 3 Lbs.
Permit: Five Permit landed, ranging between 10 and 20 Lbs.
Tarpon:
Four Tarpon between 20 and 75 Lbs landed.

‍
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in orange, pearl, and pink sizes 6 & 8 and Crazy Charlies in pink and orange.
Permit Flies: Mantis Shrimp size six and light green crab patterns.
Tarpon Flies: Black death, white toads and yellow toads.
Post Summary: Last week, fishing improved with more favorable weather conditions. Bonefish were around in good numbers, and Tarpon were rolling in a number of locations.
Post Body:
Last week, fishing improved with more favorable weather conditions. Bonefish were around in good numbers, and Tarpon were  rolling in a number of locations. We enjoyed the company of a great Father and Daughter team this week. Gordon & Meris McHaney both caught really good Tarpon of around 70 Lbs with Capt. Cesar. Meris also took a beautiful Permit of 20 Lbs.

Sadly, the lodge has now closed due to Covid-19. The silver lining is the fact that our fishery will be rested, and all the fishing pressure will be off. When we reopen, we expect an absolute ding dong kickoff !!
main image caption: Capt Cesar with guest Meris's permit.

Weather: Mostly cloudy with moderate winds from West/ North West
Bonefish: Bones landed when targeted.
Permit: One landed on a light brown Mantis Shrimp pattern.
Tarpon: Seen rolling. Would not eat.
Post Summary: We are truly delighted that yesterday was our grand re-opening! Our first angler, Ken Z went out and caught a beauty of a permit. He used a light brown Mantis Shrimp pattern. The fish were everywhere, and large numbers of Tarpon were seen rolling. They were reluctant to take flies as yesterday we had had a significant weather system pass by Belize, and with the sudden drop in Barometric pressure, the fish lost interest. Thankfully it is rising again, and we anticipate a bumper week ahead! We are so looking forward to seeing our extended El Pescador family back here in Belize ~ so do come see us soon!
Post Body:
We are truly delighted that yesterday was our grand re-opening!

Our first angler, Ken Z went out and caught a beauty of a permit. He used a light brown Mantis Shrimp pattern.
The fish were everywhere, and large numbers of Tarpon were seen rolling. They were reluctant to take flies as yesterday we had had a significant weather system pass by Belize, and with the sudden drop in Barometric pressure, the fish lost interest. Thankfully it is rising again, and we anticipate a bumper week ahead!

We are so looking forward to seeing our extended El Pescador family back here in Belize ~ so do come see us soon!

‍

‍

Weather: Mostly sunny with light winds from the North and North East. Occasional rain showers and isolated thunderstorms.
Wind: North and North East at 10 to 15 mph.
Grand Slam: hree Grand Slams were recorded! A fourth was narrowly missed with the Permit breaking the leader at the boat.
Bonefish: Big numbers of bonefish were caught this week, with fish ranging between one to three pounds.  A few fish of 5 Lbs. were also taken.
Permit: Six permit landed, ranging between 5 and 15 Lbs.
Tarpon: 10 Tarpon were caught! The fish ranged between 20 Lbs with a few in the 60 Lb Range. One fish of 80 Lbs. was landed.
Other Species: A few Barracuda and Snapper were caught. One Snook and large Jacks were around.
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in gold, pearl and pink sizes 4 & 6, and Crazy Charlies in pink and orange.
Permit Flies: Big Christmas island specials in Size 2 Orange with gold eye and Tan Squimp in size 4.
Tarpon Flies: Black/ Purple bunny and White/ Chartreuse bunnies worked well.
Post Summary: The highlight of the week was a double grand slam for Hunter R fishing with Cesar. His wife Kelsey, narrowly missed her slam with the Permit breaking the leader at the boat! Not to be outdone, she then went on to boat three good Tarpon that day! Josh fishing with Gordy also had a grand slam and took other Tarpon as well.
Post Body:
This week was excellent again, with large numbers of Permit being seen. Tarpon were around in good numbers and quite aggressive. 10 fish were landed with several in the 60-80 Lb class.

Bonefish were once again around in big numbers. Most anglers this week caught a few bones and then went on to target Tarpon and Permit.

The highlight of the week was a double grand slam for Hunter R fishing with Cesar. His wife Kelsey, narrowly missed her slam with the Permit breaking the leader at the boat! Not to be outdone, she then went on to boat three good Tarpon that day! Josh fishing with Gordy also had a grand slam and took other Tarpon as well.

‍

Weather: Mostly sunny with light winds from the West and North West Occasional rain showers and isolated thunderstorms.
Wind: West and North West at 10 to 15 mph.
Grand Slam: Four Grand Slams were recorded!
Bonefish: Many bones were caught this week with several nice fish in the 4 & 5 Lb class.
Permit: 11 permit were taken this week. Fish were all over in good numbers. They ranged between 5 and 20 Lbs.
Tarpon: This was Tarpon week !! 21 Tarpon were landed. The fish ranged between 10 lbs and 75 lbs, with four fish in the 75 lb range.
Other Species:
A few Snapper along with four large Jacks, plus Ladyfish in good numbers.

‍
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in gold, pearl and pink sizes 4 & 6, and Crazy Charlies in pink and orange.
Permit Flies: Crab patterns such as Kung fu, grand slam and hermit crabs worked well..
Tarpon Flies: Black/ Purple bunny and White/ Chartreuse bunnies worked well. These flies have been working really well since we opened.
Post Summary: This week was excellent again, with large numbers of Permit being seen. Tarpon were the story of the week, with Capt. Gordy shooting the lights out with 14 Tarpon landed by his guests. We honestly lost count of the numbers of fish that were jumped. The fishing has been incredible. Four grad slams recorded as well.
Post Body:
This week was excellent again, with large numbers of Permit being seen. Tarpon were the story of the week, with Capt. Gordy shooting the lights out with 14 Tarpon landed by his guests. We honestly lost count of the numbers of fish that were jumped. The fishing has been incredible.

The highlight of the week was a double grand slam for Tom G fishing with Capt. Junior. They also took 6 Tarpon! Gordy and his anglers were the rock stars with their Tarpon haul, and Brad M and Jason N also each had a Grand slam with Gordy... Phenomenal!

Special mention must be made of our very professional guides who have worked so hard for our guests. They are a pivotal part of our great team at El Pescador !

Congratulations to all !!
main image caption: Brad and Jason have been tearing it up while out with Capt. Gordy

Weather: Mostly sunny with light winds from the North/North West Occasional rain showers and isolated thunderstorms.
Grand Slam: No slams this week. One guest got a trip slam (each species during the week).
Bonefish: A good number of bones were caught with several  fish in the 4  Lb class.
Permit: Two permit were taken this week. Fish were all over in good numbers but very difficult to hook. They ranged between 10 and 20 Lbs.  Vanessa R fishing with Capt. Emir caught a beautiful 20 Lb fish.
Tarpon: 23 Tarpon were taken this week ranging between 5 and 70 Lbs. This was an excellent week for Tarpon!!  Jason M fishing with Capt. Gordy were successful in boating some really good fish, the biggest a beautiful specimen of 70 Lbs.
Other Species: A few Snapper were caught. Several large Jacks were also taken.
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in gold, pearl and pink sizes 4 & 6, and Crazy Charlies in pink and orange.
Permit Flies: Mantis Shrimp was the order of the day . The fish were not interested in any other flies.
Tarpon Flies: White Toads and Orange Toads worked extremely well.
Post Summary: This was a much better weather week at the lodge with us finally shaking off the effects of the two Hurricanes which battered our southern neighbors. Fortunately, we only experienced huge rain. The Tarpon are very active, and really big numbers of Permit are being seen all over. We look forward to another bumper week ahead.
Post Body:
This was a much better weather week at the lodge with us finally shaking off the effects of the two Hurricanes which battered our southern neighbors. Fortunately, we only experienced huge rain. The Tarpon are very active, and really big numbers of Permit are being seen all over. We look forward to another bumper week ahead.

‍

Weather: Intermittent rain showers and isolated thunderstorms with winds out of the North East. Heavy cloud on most days.
Grand Slam: One Grand Slam was recorded by Wade G fishing with Capt. Cesar! Congratulations.
Bonefish: A good number of bones were caught with several fish in the 3 to 4 Lb. class.
Permit: One permit were taken this week. Some good opportunities were presented, but the fish were very uncooperative!
Tarpon: Seven Tarpon were taken this week ranging between 5 and 30 Lbs.
Other Species: A few Snapper were caught. Several large Jacks and Barracuda were also taken.
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in gold, pearl and pink sizes 4 & 6, and Crazy Charlies in pink and orange.
Tarpon Flies: White Toads and Brown Toads worked well.
Post Summary: This was a slow week, with the weather playing a big part. Due to the heavy cloud and rain, sight fishing was very difficult. We are looking forward to vastly improved weather conditions next week.
Post Body: This was a slow week, with the weather playing a big part. Due to the heavy cloud and rain, sight fishing was very difficult. We are looking forward to vastly improved weather conditions next week.

Weather: Mixed weather with winds out of the North/North West switching to North East. Heavy cloud cover on most days.
Wind: North West/North East at 15 to 20 mph.
Grand Slam: One Grand Slam was recorded by Mike J fishing with Capt. Indalecio!! Congratulations!
Bonefish: Very good numbers of bones were caught with several fish in the 3 to 4 Lb. class.  Charlie S fishing with Capt. Cesar took a beautiful fish of 5 Lbs.
Permit: 11 Permit were taken ranging from 2 lbs. to 15 Lbs.
Tarpon: 8 Tarpon were taken this week ranging between 5 and 30 Lbs. The Tarpon were taking flies enthusiastically!
Other Species: Some really good Snook were taken with Dick M taking a fish of 18Lbs with Capt. Cesar. Capt. Rodger also accounted for a few fish. Several really good Jacks were also taken.
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in gold, pearl and pink sizes 4 & 6, and Crazy Charlies in pink and orange.
Permit Flies: Peterson's shrimp and Mantis shrimp.
Tarpon Flies: White Toads and Purple Toads worked well.
Post Summary: This was a good week despite the sometimes inclement weather. Fish are all over the flats, and the Snook bite is starting very well.
Post Body: This was a good week despite the sometimes inclement weather. Fish are all over the flats, and the Snook bite is starting very well.
main image caption: Charlie landed this nice Bonefish while out with Capt. Cesar.

Weather: Mixed weather with winds out of the North/North East with occasional rain showers
Grand Slam: Two Grand Slams (a double slam) were recorded by Nathan and Diana G fishing with Capt. Cesar.
Bonefish: Very good numbers of bones were caught with several fish in the 3 to 4 Lb. class.
Permit: 7 Permit were taken ranging from 2 lbs. to 15 Lbs.
Tarpon: 8 Tarpon were taken this week ranging between 5 and 30 Lbs. The tarpon were difficult to hook.
Other Species: Some really good Snook were taken with a fish of 15Lbs landed by Peter C fishing with Capt. Michael. Several really good Jacks were also taken.
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in gold, pearl and pink sizes 4 & 6, and Crazy Charlies in pink and orange.
Permit Flies: Gotcha and Mantis shrimp.
Tarpon Flies: White Toads and Purple/Black Toads worked well.
Post Summary: This was a good week. Bonefish as always, are around in big numbers all over the flats. Permit were seen everywhere, but refused flies and were extremely difficult to hook. The Snook bite is on, but the Tarpon are going off the boil.
Post Body: This was a good week.  Bonefish as always, are around in big numbers all over the flats. Permit were seen everywhere, but refused flies and were extremely difficult to hook. The Snook bite is on, but the Tarpon are going off the boil.
main image caption: Nathan G. holds up his slam Permit with Diana G while fishing with Capt. Cesar. Dianna also slammed. Making it a double that day. Just awesome!

Weather: Mixed weather with winds out of the South and South East with occasional rain showers.
Wind: South and South East at 20 to 25 mph.
Grand Slam: No Grand Slams were recorded.
Bonefish: Very good numbers of bones were caught with several fish in the 2 to 3 Lb. class.
Tarpon: Four Tarpon landed this week, ranging between 5 and 10 Lbs. The Tarpon were difficult to hook.
Other Species: Some good Snook were landed with a fish of 15 Lbs by Matt S fishing with Capt. Cesar. Anglers also landed several nice Jacks. Jacks are all over the flats at the moment and very willing to take flies.
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in gold, pearl, and pink sizes 4 & 6, and Crazy Charlies in pink and orange.
Permit Flies: Lost on a Mantis shrimp
Tarpon Flies: White Toads and Purple/Black Toads worked well.
Post Summary: This was a relatively slow week, with the weather playing a big part. Cloudy days made it difficult to spot fish, and the wind added to our woes. Permit were seen everywhere but refused flies and were extremely difficult to hook. Young Marshall S landed a beautiful Permit of 20 lbs using a live crab, and his Dad Josh broke one off. The Snook bite is on.
Post Body: This was a relatively slow week, with the weather playing a big part. Cloudy days made it difficult to spot fish, and the wind added to our woes. Permit were seen everywhere but refused flies and were extremely difficult to hook. Young Marshall S landed a beautiful Permit of 20 lbs using a live crab, and his Dad Josh broke one off. The Snook bite is on.

Weather: Mixed weather with winds out of the North and North East at 8 to 15 miles per hour with occasional rain showers.
Wind: North and North East at 8 to 15 Mph.
Grand Slam: No Grand Slams were recorded
Bonefish: Very good numbers of bones were caught with one fish in the 5lb. class.
Tarpon: One Tarpon of 20 lbs was taken
Other Species: A good number of Jacks were taken and our spin fishermen caught very good numbers of Snapper
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in gold, pearl and pink sizes 4 & 6, and Crazy Charlies in pink and orange.
Tarpon Flies: White mini diver
Post Summary: Fishing was very slow this week due to a small number of guests in the lodge and some unfavorable weather. Most of our guests were spin fishermen with 1 large group visiting us on a team building exercise.
Post Body: Fishing was very slow this week due to a small number of guests in the lodge and some unfavorable weather. Most of our guests were spin fishermen with 1 large group visiting us on a team building exercise.

Weather: Partly sunny and windy conditions during the middle of most days. Temperatures remain cooler
Wind: E 15/24 - 20/32 Mph/Kph. Gusting to 25/40 Mph/Kph shifting to N 15/24 - 20/32 Mph/Kph as fronts move through
Moon Phase: Waning Crescent through the 31st when new moon comes into play
Bonefish: Good numbers of Bonefish (120+) were landed averaging 2/3 lbs.
Tarpon: Four
Other Species: Eight Snook and three Large Jack Crevalles landed from schools of 20 + fish.
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in gold, pearl and pink sizes and Crazy Charlies in pink and orange. Sizes 4, 6 & 8
Permit Flies: Mantis shrimp, Casa Blanca Raghead w Yellow Eyes, Bauer, Merkin and Strong Arm Crabs. Sizes 4 & 6
Tarpon Flies: White Tarpon bunnies, chartreuse and black-purple Tarpon Toads in sizes 2/0 and 3/0
Post Summary: Seasonal fronts, cooler temperatures and moist conditions prevail in Northern Belize. Bonefish continue to be plentiful, increasing numbers of Snook are being caught cruising the shorelines, and several 50 lb+ Tarpon have been landed to the south.
Post Body: Seasonal fronts, cooler temperatures and moist conditions prevail in Northern Belize.  Bonefish continue to be plentiful, increasing numbers of Snook are being caught cruising the shorelines, and several 50 lb+ Tarpon have been landed to the south.
main image caption: First Tarpon on the fly for William w Capt Roger. Congratulations William!

Weather: Sunny skies with fresh winds from East/South East
Wind: East and South East at 15-25 MPH.
Grand Slam: No Grand Slams were recorded
Bonefish:
Very good numbers of bones were caught with several fish in the 5lb. class. Joel M & Mike B accounted for 35 Bones in one day!

‍
Tarpon: One Tarpon was landed.

Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in gold, pearl and pink sizes 4 & 6, and Crazy Charlies in pink and orange.
Permit Flies: Mantis Shrimp and Strong Arm Crab.

Post Summary: Fishing was good this week with the focus on Bonefish as we hosted the Orvis Bonefish Bonanza. The group caught excellent numbers of Bones, with the Permit being a bit tougher.

Weather: Mostly sunny weather with light winds from the east
Wind: East and North East at 10 -15 Mph.
Grand Slam: Four Grand Slams this week. Amazing!
Bonefish: Very good numbers of bones were caught. They were all over the flats ranging between 2 – 5 Lbs.
Tarpon:
5 Tarpon of between 10 and 40 lbs. were taken

‍
Other Species: A few Snapper were caught.
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in gold, pearl and pink sizes 4 & 6, and Crazy Charlies in pink and orange.

Post Summary: Fishing was excellent this week with 4 Grand slams!!! Capt. Kristian had two slams with Nick E and Josh L. Cesar with Rodger H. had one, and Capt. Geo had one with 13 year old Jack W. Capt Kristian also caught two other permit and was on fire this week ! All species were very willing to take flies, and the spring/summer season is starting off with a bang !
Post Body:
Fishing was excellent this week with 4 Grand slams!!!

Capt. Kristian had two slams with Nick E and Josh L.

Cesar with Rodger H. had one, and Capt. Geo had one with 13 year old Jack W.

Capt Kristian  also caught two other permit and was on fire this week !

All species were very willing to take flies, and the spring/summer season is starting off with a bang !

‍

Weather: Mostly sunny weather with moderate winds from the east changing to a fresh Northerly wind at 25 Mph
Wind: East at 15 -20 Mph, changing to a fresh Northerly wind at 25 Mph.
Grand Slam: 1 Grand Slam was recorded for Katie W.
Bonefish: Very good numbers of bones were caught. Some big schools have been seen and a most were in the 1-3 Lbs range.
Tarpon: 8 Tarpon of between 5 - 75 lbs were taken.
Other Species:
A few Snapper were caught and Barracuda were also plentiful. Several big Jacks were caught.

‍
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in gold, pearl and pink sizes 4 & 6, and Crazy Charlies in pink and orange.
Permit Flies: Mantis shrimp and Flexo and grand slam crabs.
Tarpon Flies: EP divers and black/purple toads. White toads remain the fly of choice.
Post Summary: Fishing was excellent this week with 1 Grand slam. Capt. Ketchu had a slam with Katie W. On the same day they had three Permit ! Without a doubt, the week was all about Permit. They were really feeding well, and our anglers enjoyed a true "purple patch". Dick R caught 5 permit on one day with Capt. Cesar.
Post Body: Fishing was excellent this week with 1 Grand slam.  Capt. Ketchu had a slam with Katie W. On the same day they had three Permit ! Without a doubt, the week was all about Permit. They were really feeding well, and our anglers enjoyed a true "purple patch".  Dick R caught 5 permit on one day with Capt. Cesar.

Post Summary: Fishing was super this week, and thankfully the wind subsided. The highlight of the week was young Wilkes H, who caught a beautiful 20 lb. Permit on the fly with Capt. Cesar. He is the youngest angler to have landed a Permit on the fly at El Pescador. He and his family also qualified as open water scuba divers.

Grand Slam: Five Grand Slams were recorded!
Bonefish: Good numbers of bones were caught. Most were in the 2-5 Lbs range, with one fish of 5 Lbs.
Tarpon: 32 Tarpon were taken. They ranged between 5 and 70 lbs.
Other Species: A few Snappers were caught and Barracuda were also around. Several big Jacks were caught.

Post Summary: Fishing was excellent again this week. Our Permit purple patch continues with no less than 37 fish landed! Permit are all over the flats at the moment. 32 Tarpon were also landed, and five grand slams were recorded. Gordon J had a triple grand slam fishing with Capt. Cesar! Cobert W had a slam with Capt. Vincent, and David F had a slam with Capt. Jeo. Another fantastic week!
Post Body: Fishing was excellent again this week. Our Permit purple patch continues with no less than 37 fish landed! Permit are all over the flats at the moment. 32 Tarpon were also landed, and five grand slams were recorded. Gordon J had a triple grand slam fishing with Capt. Cesar!  Cobert W. had a slam with Capt. Vincent, and David F. had a slam with Capt. Jeo. Another fantastic week!

Grand Slam: Robert F. had a triple grand slam fishing with Capt. Gordy
Bonefish: Huge numbers of bones were caught. In one day, we totaled over 100 fish! Most were in the 2-4 Lb range, with one fish of 4 Lbs.
Tarpon: Nine Tarpon were landed. They ranged between 5 and 80 lbs.
Other Species: Barracuda were around. Several big Jacks were caught.

Nine Tarpon were also landed, and one triple grand slam was recorded. Robert F had a triple grand slam fishing with Capt. Gordy! Capt. Cesar had a Tarpon of 80 lbs. Capt Gordy was on fire with a weekly haul of 24 Permit and 7 Tarpon.

Fishing was excellent again this week. Our Permit purple patch just goes on with no less than 42 fish landed! Permit are all over the flats at the moment.  Nine Tarpon were also landed, and one triple grand slam was recorded. Robert F had a triple grand slam fishing with Capt. Gordy!  Capt. Weather: Mostly sunny weather with moderate to fresh winds from the east /southeast at 20-30 Mph
Grand Slam: One Grand Slam for the week.
Bonefish: Large numbers of bones were caught. Most were in the 2-4 Lb range. They are all over the flats in good numbers.
Tarpon:
Four Tarpon were taken. They ranged between 30 and 110lbs.

‍
Other Species: Some big Jacks were caught. Brian G and his Son Trevor caught several good fish with Capt. Cesar
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in gold, pearl and pink sizes 4 & 6, and Crazy Charlies in pink and orange.

Tarpon Flies: White bunnies and black/purple bunnies are the flies of choice.
Post Summary: Fishing was excellent again this week, despite all but two days being very windy. Our run on Permit continued, with a total of 21 fish landed. Capt. Gordy managed a haul of 9 fish on one day! Tarpon were around in the South and a number of good fish were lost. We are holding thumbs that the big fish will arrive soon. Trevor G (13 years old) had a fish of 80 Lbs. with Capt. Cesar.
Post Body:
Fishing was excellent again this week, despite all but two days being very windy. Our run on Permit continued, with a total of 21 fish landed. Capt. Gordy managed a haul of 9 fish on one day!

Tarpon were around in the South and a number of good fish were lost. We are holding thumbs that the big fish will arrive soon. Trevor G (13 years old) had a fish of 80 Lbs. with Capt. Cesar.

‍
main image caption: Last Sunday, Matt T. landed his first Permit while out with Capt. Jeo. Matt said, "One of the best catches of my life." Matt is pictured here holding his Permit. His dad Ken, also landed his first Permit with Capt. Michael. Now that's a great father/son experience!

Grand Slam: Three Grand Slams were recorded! The fishery is on fire!
Bonefish: Good numbers of bones were caught  Most were in the 2-4 Lb range.
Tarpon: Seven Tarpon were taken. Most were juvenile fish between 5 and 20 Lbs. The big migratory Tarpon are starting to arrive!
Other Species:
Some big Jacks were caught and three good Snook were also landed.

‍
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in gold, pearl and pink sizes 4 & 6, and Crazy Charlies in pink and orange.
Permit Flies: Mantis shrimp and Flexo crabs. Reggae crabs also worked.
Tarpon Flies: White bunnies and black/purple bunnies are the flies of choice.
Post Summary:
Fishing was excellent again this week, despite the strong winds. Permit are still being caught in good numbers, and the big migratory Tarpon are starting to show up!
Chris & Vanessa R had a great week fishing with Capt Emir. Vanessa had a Slam on day one, and they went on to have a double Slam the next day which included a double header on Permit ! This all on Vanessa's birthday.
Post Body:
Fishing was excellent again this week, despite the strong winds. Permit are still being caught in good numbers, and the big migratory Tarpon are starting to show up!

Chris & Vanessa R had a great week fishing with Capt. Emir. Vanessa had a Slam on day one, and they went on to have a double Slam the next day which included a double header on Permit ! This all on Vanessa's birthday.
main image caption: Chris, Capt. Emir, and Vanessa with a their double grand slam Permit double on Vanessa's birthday!

Weather: Mostly sunny weather with fresh to strong winds from the East at 20-30 Mph
Grand Slam: Two Grand Slams were recorded!
Bonefish: Good numbers of bones were caught  Most were in the 2-4 Lb. range.
Tarpon: 15 Tarpon were taken. Most were juvenile fish between 5 and 20 Lbs. The big migratory Tarpon are starting to arrive!

Other Species: Rounding out the week anglers landed some big Jacks, and Barracuda. Six Snook also laded.
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in gold, pearl and pink sizes 4 & 6, and Crazy Charlies in pink and orange.
Permit Flies: Mantis shrimp, rag head crabs and Flexo crabs. Crabs continue to be preferred over other patterns.

Other Species: Rounding out the week, anglers landed some Jacks, snapper, a small shark,  as well as Barracuda.
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in gold, pearl and pink sizes 4 & 6, and Crazy Charlies in pink and orange.

We saw increases in the number of Permit landed, three by one angler in one outing. Our anglers also landed several larger Bonefish and several hooked Tarpon in the 40 to 50 lb class.

Post Summary: Strong fronts regularly moving across Ambergris Caye with sustained easterly winds gusting to 25 mph have suppressed fishing numbers. Bonefish landed in good numbers, and large Snook were seen and caught in the lagoons. Juvenile Tarpon up to 20/9 lbs/kg have been active in and around mangroves.
Post Body: Strong fronts regularly moving across Ambergris Caye with sustained easterly winds gusting to 25 mph have suppressed fishing numbers. Bonefish landed in good numbers, and large Snook were seen and caught in the lagoons. Juvenile Tarpon up to 20/9 lbs/kg have been active in and around mangroves. A highlight of the week, David's 35" Snook while being guided by Capt Gordy

Weather: Partly sunny and windy conditions during the middle of most days. Temperatures trending warmer
Wind: ENE 15/24 - 20/32 Mph/Kph. Gusting to 25/40 Mph/Kph shifting to N 15/24 - 20/32 Mph/Kph as fronts move through

Several anglers made friends with some larger tarpon, and a nice baby tarpon was landed off our dock.

Post Body: Improving weather conditions and less rain have increased the bite this week.  Winds continue to shift regularly from the East to North East diminishing to  5 to 15 Mph and gusting to 20 as fronts move through the area.  Bonefish numbers are plentiful (170), increasing numbers of Permit and Tarpon are being landed along with a single very nice snook. Two grand slams and a boat slam recorded.

Post Summary: Tropical Storm Bonnie has brought higher winds and strong rain bands through the area. Winds continue to shift regularly from the East to North East from 5 to 15 and gusting to 20-25. Less visibility for the past three days has impacted catch percentages dropping Bonefish numbers to 130 for the week, increased Permit and large Tarpon are being hooked and landed along with two nice sized Snook and two more Grand Slams!

Air Temp: Ranging from high 80s in the evening to mid to high 80s during the day in the coastal zone.
Moon Phase: Waxing Gibbous, Full Moon Aug 11 (next phase)
Grand Slam: Torrin courtesy of Capt Jeo 8/1, Jon working with Capt Junior. Wesley courtesy of Capt Nestor and Brandon courtesy of Capt Emir all caught grand slams on fly.
Bonefish: Good numbers of Bonefish (210) were landed averaging 2/3 lbs larger bones 3/5 lbs in the lagoons.
Tarpon: Eighteen Tarpon landed.
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in gold, pearl and pink sizes and Crazy Charlies in pink and orange. Sizes 4, 6 & 8
Permit Flies: Mantis shrimp, Casa Blanca Raghead w Yellow Eyes, Bauer, Merkin, Alphlexo and Strong Arm Crabs. Sizes 4 & 6
Tarpon Flies: White Tarpon bunnies, chartreuse and black-purple Tarpon Toads in sizes 2/0 and 3/0
Post Summary: Cloudy and partly cloudy conditions with increasing winds and choppy seas persist. Winds continue shift regularly from the East to North East and at 15 - 20 mph. Periodic intermittent showers pop up during the day but don't hamper fishing. Bonefish numbers have remained consistent in the past 2 weeks well over 200. Tarpon and Permit numbers average at 20 for the week ending Sunday. Our Grand Slam successes still amaze us!

Post Summary: Seasonal fronts and cooler temperatures throughout the area surrounding Ambergris Caye continue to challenge anglers. Bonefish are continuing to be caught in good numbers in the lagoons. Schools of Permit are being sighted and Tarpon have been hooked but both in limited numbers. Cooler temps also bring increasing numbers of larger snook to the areas in and around the mainland coast.

Post Summary: The fishing conditions around Ambergris Caye are difficult due to seasonal fronts, cooler temperatures and strong winds. Bonefish and Permit are being spotted in good numbers, with Tarpon being caught in limited numbers and a 100 lb+ Tarpon caught in recent weeks. Fishing along the Belize mainland coast has seen increasing numbers of larger Snook being landed.
Post Body: Seasonal fronts, cooler temperatures and strong winds continue in and around Ambergris Caye. Water conditions have become cloudy with higher winds making for challenging conditions. Bonefish are continuing to be caught in good numbers on the flats. Schools of Permit are being sighted and Tarpon have been hooked but both in limited numbers. We caught our first 100 lb + Tarpon in several weeks. Increasing numbers of larger Snook are being landed along the Belize mainland coast.
main image caption: Healthy populations of bonefish often make for plenty of opportunities to take on these impressively speedy fish. Phoenix with a good one from a day with Capt. Gordy.

Post Summary: Fishing conditions around Ambergris Caye have been difficult this past week due to strong winds and cloudy water. Despite the challenging conditions, Bonefish, Permit, and Tarpon have been caught, although not in great numbers. Tarpon have been the most difficult to catch.
Post Body: Seasonal fronts, cooler temperatures and strong winds continue for a second week in and around Ambergris Caye.  Water conditions have become cloudy with higher winds making for challenging conditions.  Catch rates are below average this past week, Bonefish are being caught largely through blind casting on the flats. Schools of Permit are being sighted and Tarpon have been hooked but both in limited numbers.  Tarpon have been the most challenging to catch.
main image caption: Kate with a great fish while out with Capt. Kechu. Congrats, Kate!

Post Summary: The fishing conditions in Ambergris Caye, Belize are getting better with warmer temperatures and lighter winds. There have been fewer fish caught than usual, but Bonefish, Permit and Tarpon are still being seen and caught.
Post Body: Seasonal fronts have passed, and warmer temperatures and moderate winds have settled in around Ambergris Caye. Wind conditions are from the E/SE 5-15 consistently. Catch rates have remained below average this past week; Bonefish are being caught mainly through blind casting on the flats. Schools of Permit continue to be sighted and hooked but Tarpon are being caught in limited numbers.

Post Summary: Rolling cold fronts have been the trend over the past week on Ambergris Caye. Wind conditions are from the E/NE 15-25 consistently. High wind conditions require guides to resort to fishing protected areas to the west and north in the Bacalar Chico National Park and Marine Reserve. Likewise, Permit and Tarpon have been challenging to locate and catch rates remain below average for this time of the year. Small Tarpon and Snook can be found in and around mangrove growth but require greater accuracy to hook up.
Post Body: Rolling cold fronts have been the trend over the past week on Ambergris Caye. Wind conditions are from the E/NE 15-25 consistently.   High wind conditions require guides to resort to fishing protected areas to the west and north in the Bacalar Chico National Park and Marine Reserve. Likewise, Permit and Tarpon have been challenging to locate and catch rates remain below average for this time of the year. Small Tarpon and Snook can be found in and around mangrove growth but require greater accuracy to hook up.

Post Summary: Conditions have improved significantly during the past week, and our normal lovely days of very low winds and bright sunny days are back. Water clarity has been ideal on the flats. Large migrating Permit are being targeted and caught in the deeper channels, and Tarpon are being found on coastline flats to the north. Small Tarpon and Snook continue to be found in and around mangrove growth along the sargasso grass lines.
Post Body: Conditions have improved significantly during the past week, and our normal lovely days of very low winds and bright sunny days are back.    Water clarity has been ideal on the flats. Large migrating Permit are being targeted and caught in the deeper channels, and Tarpon are being found on coastline flats to the north. Small Tarpon and Snook continue to be found in and around mangrove growth along the sargasso grass lines.

Tarpon Flies: White Chartreuse Bunnies, Chartreuse and Black-purple toads in sizes 1/0 to 3/0.
Post Summary: Winds shift from East to North East as cold fronts move through the local area of Ambergris Caye. Permit and Tarpon are being landed on the northern flats outside Bocolar Chico Park. Small Tarpon and Snook continue be found in and around mangrove growth during cooler temperatures and low tide.
Post Body: Winds shift from East to North East as cold fronts move through the local area of Ambergris Caye.   Permit and Tarpon are being landed  on the northern flats outside Bocolar Chico Park.    Small Tarpon and Snook continue be found in and around mangrove growth during cooler temperatures and low tide.

Weather: High wind conditions during early hours and during the middle of the day. Sunny to Partly Cloudy, temperatures in the low 80s. Precipitation: light to none
Moon Phase: New Moon February 20, Waxing Crescent February 27
Bonefish: Good numbers of Bonefish (164) were landed averaging 2 to 3 lbs, several ranging 3 to 6 lbs.
Tarpon: Three landed.
Other Species: Mangrove Snapper
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in gold, pearl, root beer and pink sizes 4 & 6.
Permit Flies: Mantis shrimp, Rag Head crabs, Bauer crabs and Alflexo crabs in sizes 4 & 6.
Tarpon Flies: White Chartreuse Bunnies, Chartreuse and Black-purple toads in sizes 1/0 to 3/0.
Post Summary: Increasing bouts with high winds gusting above 25 mph have hampered fishing conditions this past week. The sun has been out consistently, though. Permit and Tarpon are challenging to see on the flats despite the sunny weather because the wind creates more chop on the water. Anglers have focused on schools of Bonefish, and small Tarpon and Snook continue to be found in and around mangrove growth during cooler temperatures and low tide. We have had patches of good permit fishing.
Post Body: Increasing bouts with high winds gusting above 25 mph have hampered fishing conditions this past week. The sun has been out consistently, though. Permit and Tarpon are challenging to see on the flats despite the sunny weather because the wind creates more chop on the water. Anglers have focused on schools of Bonefish, and small Tarpon and Snook continue to be found in and around mangrove growth during cooler temperatures and low tide. We have had patches of good permit fishing.
main image caption: Brent of the Andrus Bros Group wasted no time on day one when he caught this permit with spin gear while fishing with Capt. Kristian.

Post Summary: Bouts of high winds gusting above 25 mph had hampered fishing conditions this past week until the weekend when winds returned to normal levels. The sun has been out consistently, though. Permit and Tarpon were challenging to see on the flats despite the sunny weather because the wind created more chop on the water. Fish were relatively grabby when we could get on them, and the weekend was more fun with gentler breezes.
Post Body: Bouts of high winds gusting above 25 mph had hampered fishing conditions this past week until the weekend when winds returned to normal levels. The sun has been out consistently, though. Permit and Tarpon were challenging to see on the flats despite the sunny weather because the wind created more chop on the water. Fish were relatively grabby when we could get on them, and the weekend was more fun with gentler breezes.

Weather: Normal trade-winds from the east from 8-16 mph. Sunny to Partly Cloudy, temperatures in the low to mid-80s. Precipitation: light to none
Moon Phase: Waxing Crescent March 14, New Moon March 21
Grand Slam: Two slams this week.
Bonefish: Good numbers of Bonefish (186) were landed, averaging 2 to 3 lbs, with several ranging from 3 to 6 lbs
Tarpon: 11 Tarpon landed.
Other Species: Mangrove Snapper

Post Summary: We have been enjoying our normal tradewinds this week, which has shown in excellent fishing due to an influx of sargassum that had a lot of fish working the reef side of the islands. We found fish consistently and generally had fish to work all day out there. They weren't as consistent about eating, but life can't be perfect! All in all, a great week to be in Belize.
Post Body: We have been enjoying our normal tradewinds this week, which has shown in excellent fishing due to an influx of sargassum that had a lot of fish working the reef side of the islands. We found fish consistently and generally had fish to work all day out there. They weren't as consistent about eating, but life can't be perfect! All in all, a great week to be in Belize.
main image caption: First tarpon on a fly! Chase B. landed this tarpon when fishing with Capt. Michael today! Great way to spend his first day of spring break!

Bonefish:
Good numbers of Bonefish (196) were landed, averaging 2 to 3 lbs, with several ranging from 3 to 6 lbs

‍

Post Summary: Some high winds have returned this week. Fishing has still been good, but open water has been rougher, so we have concentrated our fishing on the back side of the island.
Post Body: Some high winds have returned this week. Fishing has still been good, but open water has been rougher, so we have concentrated our fishing on the back side of the island.
main image caption: First bonefish on the fly! Madison S. caught this bonefish while out with Capt. Kechu.

Weather: Tradewinds from the east from 12-18 mph. Sunny to Partly Cloudy, temperatures in the low 80s. Precipitation: light to none.
Bonefish: Good numbers of Bonefish (124) were landed, averaging 2 to 3 lbs, with several ranging 3 to 6 lbs
Tarpon: Four Tarpon
Other Species: One Snook and some Mangrove Snapper, Barracuda, Mutton Snapper, Jack Crevalle, and Needle Fish
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in gold, pearl, root beer and pink sizes 4 & 6.
Permit Flies: Mantis shrimp, Rag Head crabs, Bauer crabs and Alflexo crabs in sizes 4 & 6.
