Weather: Partly Cloudy to Sunny.
Air Temp: High and low in the low 80's.
Grand Slam: Geff T. fishing with Capt. Cesar.
Bonefish: Lighter winds provided clear water opportunities to sight cast to larger bonefish in the shallows.
Permit: Several permit were landed by fly anglers this week.
Tarpon:
Tarpon fishing improved as the week progressed. The action for big migratory fish is in full swing.

Post Summary: A week that started windy and cloudy turned very lovely at the weekend, providing a lot of angling opportunities. Highlights included a Grand Slam by Geff with Capt. Cesar and a 100+ pound Tarpon by Justin on a day trip with Capt. Vince.
Post Body:
A week that started windy and cloudy turned very lovely at the weekend, providing a lot of angling opportunities. Highlights included a Grand Slam by Geff with Capt. Cesar and a 100+ pound Tarpon by Justin on a day trip with Capt. Vince.

‍
main image caption: Tarpon On! for Geff and Captain Isa.

Weather: Mostly sunny weather with mild to moderate winds from the East at 5-15 Mph
Grand Slam: FOUR Grand Slams were recorded: Alan G. with Capt. Gordy, Thomas C. with Capt. Ketchu and Nate H. and Christain Y. with Capt. Geo!
Bonefish:
Lots of bones were caught for the week.  Most were in the 2-4 Lb range. Anglers even landed a couple of nice sized bonefish off the dock in the evening.

‍
Tarpon: 18 Tarpon were taken. Most were juvenile fish between 10 and 20 Lbs., but we did have two lovely fish about 100 Lbs. The big migratory Tarpon have arrived!
Other Species: 1 Snook , also rounding out the week anglers landed some big Jacks, as well as Barracuda and Ladyfish.
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in gold, pearl and pink sizes 4 & 6, and Crazy Charlies in pink and orange.
Permit Flies: Mantis shrimp, rag head crabs and Flexo crabs. Crabs continue to be preferred over other patterns.
Tarpon Flies: White bunnies, chartreuse and black/purple bunnies are the flies of choice.
Post Summary: Fishing was very good this week, with mostly clear skies and softer moderate winds. Lots of shots at schools of permit and Tarpon.
Post Body: Fishing was very good this week, with mostly clear skies and softer moderate winds. Lots of shots at schools of permit and Tarpon.
main image caption: Mr. J landed this beautiful Permit while out with Capt. Kristian.

Weather: Mostly sunny with light winds from the North/North West Occasional rain showers and isolated thunderstorms.
Grand Slam: No Grand Slams were recorded. We did have 3 "trip slams."
Bonefish: A good number of bones are available with several nice fish in the 4 & 5 Lb class.
Permit: Four permit were landed this week. Permit were all over in good numbers. They ranged between 5 and 20 Lbs.
Tarpon: 11 Tarpon were landed this week ranging between 20 and 100 Lbs. The best fish was a beautiful 100Lb specimen landed by John C.!
Other Species: A few Snapper were caught as well as two large Jacks.
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in gold, pearl and pink sizes 4 & 6, and Crazy Charlies in pink and orange.
Permit Flies: Crab patterns such as grand slam and hermit crabs worked well.
Tarpon Flies: Black/ Purple bunny and White/ Chartreuse bunnies worked well. Plain white bunnies were also good. These flies have been working really well since we re-opened.
Post Summary: This was a much quieter week in the lodge with fewer anglers, but nevertheless, good results were enjoyed. We had 3 "trip slams" with John C, Dan C, and Bob B catching all three species. The highlight of the week was a magnificent 100 Lb. Tarpon was landed by John C fishing with Capt Cesar.
Post Body:
This was a much quieter week in the lodge with fewer anglers, but nevertheless, good results were enjoyed. We had 3 "trip slams" with John C, Dan C, and Bob B catching all three species. The highlight of the week was a magnificent 100 Lb. Tarpon was landed by John C fishing with Capt Cesar.

main image caption: Capt. Cesar (left) and John C. are all smiles after landing this 100Lb tarpon! Can you blame them?

Weather: Winds primarily out of the north with clouds and showers at times.
Grand Slam: None this week.
Bonefish: About 250 bones were landed for the week; most were in the 2-4 pound range.
Tarpon: 22 Tarpon landed.
Other Species: Seven Snook landed.
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in gold, pearl and pink sizes 4 & 6, and Crazy Charlies in pink and orange.

Post Summary: Despite a mix of some rain and cloudy skies that made seeing fish challenging, our anglers had a good week.
Post Body: Despite a mix of some rain and cloudy skies that made seeing fish challenging, our anglers had a good week.
main image caption: Big bone fish for Brooklyn

Weather: Mostly sunny with light winds from the South and South West
Wind: South / South West at 10 to 15 mph.
Grand Slam: One Grand Slam was recorded by JC and Capt. Jeo!
Bonefish: Good numbers of bonefish were caught this week with most ranging between 1 Lb. and 3 Lbs. and a few at 5 Lbs. were also taken.
Permit: 5 permit were taken ranging between 5 and 20 Lbs.
Tarpon: 26 Tarpon were caught!  Many in the 30 -  60 Lb. range. One fish of 100 Lbs. was landed.
Other Species: A few Barracuda and Snapper were caught.
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in orange, pearl and pink sizes 6 & 8 and Crazy Charlies in pink and orange.
Permit Flies: Kung Fu crab, Bower crab and Peterson shrimp. One fish was taken on a Mantis shrimp.
Tarpon Flies: Black death, White toad, Purple bunny and Chartreuse toad.
Post Summary: This week was truly incredible with huge numbers of Permit being seen. They were very difficult to hook, and made the anglers work very hard ! Bonefish were around in big numbers and so many were caught daily that we do not have an accurate tally. One boat accounted for over 20 fish in a day ! The big story of the week was definitely the Tarpon. Fish were spotted everywhere, and our guests enjoyed a true bonanza. JC and Jeo hooked 10 Tarpon in one day and boated 4. The biggest fish was a good 60 lbs.
Post Body:
This week was truly incredible with huge numbers of Permit being seen. They were very difficult to hook, and made the anglers work very hard !
Bonefish were around in big numbers and so many were caught daily that  we do not have an accurate tally. One boat accounted for over 20 fish in a day !

The big story of the week was definitely the Tarpon. Fish were spotted everywhere, and our guests enjoyed a true bonanza. JC and Jeo hooked 10 Tarpon in one day and boated 4. The biggest fish was a good 60 lbs.

Mike and Bill boated 3 in one day and went on to catch a few more.

The story of the week was Bryan fishing with Cesar. We honestly don't know how many Tarpon they hooked, but they boated 14. The biggest fish was a beautiful specimen of 100 Lbs. ! A total of 26 Tarpon were boated.

This was a very special week, and mention must be made of our top quality guides for putting guests on the fish. To quote a 16 time returning guest, Ken Z " The El Pescador guides are probably the best flats guides in the world"

We agree with him . Well done to our amazing team!
main image caption: Bryan landed this 100-lb. tarpon while out with Capt. Cesar.

Weather: Lots of sun and our first fall cooler temps made for a very pleasant week.
Moon Phase: New Moon October 14, Full Moon October 28
Bonefish: More than 186 Bonefish were landed averaging 2 to 3 lbs, several ranging 3 to 5 lbs
Tarpon: Seven Tarpon landed, many more seen.
Other Species: Five Snook this week.
Bonefish Flies: Christmas Island Specials in gold, pearl, root beer and pink sizes 4 & 6.
Permit Flies: Mantis shrimp, Rag Head crabs, Bauer crabs and Alflexocrabs in sizes 4 & 6.
Tarpon Flies: White Chartreuse Bunnies, Chartreuse and Black-purple toads in sizes 1/0 to 3/0.
Post Summary: Ambergris Caye's El Pescador Lodge and Villas had an exciting week with a refreshing cold front, successful fishing adventures, and even a glimpse of an eclipse. If you're seeking a thrilling fly fishing experience in Belize's tropical paradise, pack your bags and join us at El Pescador for an unforgettable adventure. 🌴🎣 #BelizeAdventure #ElPescadorExperience
Post Body:
What a great week on Ambergris Caye! We had our first cold front of the fall, and it was glorious. Winds out of the north most of the week made it feel much cooler on the island, even though the temperatures didn't change too much. It allowed us to get over to the mainland more often, and we caught some nice snook.

Keith brought a crew down from Houston for a quick trip, and we had a great time with many folks experiencing Belize and El Pescador for the first time. They had a lot of fun learning to saltwater flyfish and caught many fish in just two days of fishing. We look forward to seeing them all again soon.

Some long-term friends and clients from Virginia, Dennis Stanley, and his family and friends, came in to enjoy the great weather, also.

The eclipse was a mixed bag for us and came through while most of our guests were out fishing. The staff had fun finding different ways to look at it. Some of them turned out great, especially how the light filtered through the palm fronds in moon-like shapes. Some guests got excellent video through holes in the clouds that worked perfectly.

We had quite a bit of sun this week, which led to good permit fishing in a wide variety of sizes. The tarpon weren't biting great, but we saw many of them, hooked a good number, and landed enough! Overall, I can't complain!

‍
